translated: The Birth Story of the Wild Goose

analyzed: pāṭhīnam pāvusam maccha  bala jam muñjarohita
translated: Pangolin, monsoon fish, and eel,🔽and the red-striped fish from the reeds—
sitting on the bank of the Ganges,
this is the food you eat.”

analyzed: na vā aham etam bhuñjāmi  jaṅgalān odakāni vā
translated: “I don’t eat that,🔽or anything from the wilds or water,

analyzed: na vā aham etam sat dahāmi

translated: in the village, salt and oil.
But I don’t have a body like you,
That’s why you have such a body.
You’re opposed by the whole world,
duck, because of your evil deeds.
Even when you get some food, it doesn’t satisfy you.
That’s why you have such a body.”
without sorrow, without fear from any quarter.
Live in the world without harming,
and you will be dear to me as I am to myself.

analyzed: yaḥ na hanti na ghātā iti
translated: He who neither kills nor causes to kill,
neither conquers nor causes to conquer,
who is full of loving-kindness towards all beings,
with him no one has any quarrel.”
